intro: Pennilabium angraecoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Pennilabium angraecoides is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
